Title: Lead Analyst, Paid Media
Description:
About Bluevine

Bluevine is on a mission to enable a better financial future for small business owners through innovative banking solutions designed just for them. By combining best-in-class technology with advanced security and a deep understanding of the small business community, we deliver end-to-end banking and lending products that empower always-on entrepreneurs to grow their businesses with confidence.

As a dynamic company with massive potential, we’re backed by leading investors such as Lightspeed Venture Partners, Menlo Ventures, 83North, Citi Ventures, and nearly 9 years of proven success. Since launching in 2013, we have grown exponentially, amassing over 400,000 customers across all 50 states and a global team of more than 500 people. Our passion is driven by purpose: to give small businesses the tools they need to succeed and we’re just getting started.

All of this begins with our team who are driven by collaboration, problem-solving, and learning and growing together. With a commitment to innovation and community impact, our mission is to help every small business—and every team member—thrive. Join us!

Bluevine is seeking an experienced marketing analytics professional to provide insights into our customers and marketing efforts. You will conduct strategic analysis, help structure and optimize campaigns, and build and maintain highly visible reporting with an impact felt across the organization. The successful candidate is strategic, data-driven, and action-oriented with sharp business acumen.

You will also advance Bluevine’s thinking on the tools we need to deliver these insights, guiding the direction of the technology stack used to analyze marketing data, as well as underlying data. To do this, you will work with internal teams and outside vendors on projects such as developing multi-touch attribution logic, implementing campaign governance structures (e.g. UTM code structures), and more.

You will directly contribute toward program initiation, delivery and performance reporting. You will build views and analyses that inform and direct the marketing team, including self-service dashboards, weekly recap insights, NPS analysis, A/B/n and multivariate tests, and ad hoc investigations. Success in the role will require you to connect ongoing marketing efforts directly to business outcomes.

You will work with stakeholders across the marketing team (growth, product, web, partner, brand/comms), as well as other cross functional groups, like business operations, product, business intelligence, data engineering, and data science.

What You’ll Do

Work collaboratively with senior marketing and business stakeholders to identify business needs and provide data-driven insights and opportunities for improvement within our marketing organizationDefine KPIs, monitor marketing and site performance, and create clear reporting for stakeholders, offering recommendations to drive better business outcomesCreate automated dashboards to enable stakeholders to monitor business performance on traffic, conversion rates, and funnel behaviorsWork with marketing stakeholders to optimize and forecast existing channel and campaign performance. Make recommendations for campaign adjustments in order to meet/exceed our budget goals.Launch new channels with the team, choosing audiences and markets and thinking strategically about performance measurement and what success looks like.Oversee daily, weekly, and monthly analytics and reporting for our paid media acquisition campaigns across all channels including Paid Search (Google, Bing), Paid Social (i.e., Facebook, LinkedIn, Instagram), Display, Programmatic, Video, OOH, and Radio.Implement A/B and multi-variant testing plus other optimization techniques to drive improvements. Anlayze tests from start to finish to ensure tests are set up correctly and results are measurable. Make recommendations on rollout and/or next steps.Understand how Organic traffic and how it interacts with paid campaigns tracking organic performance along with paid initiatives.Understand Bluevine’s customer segments and the behavior of each. Leverage analytics to find opportunities within each segment.Own channel attribution working with attrition tools to assign proper credit to channels within the conversion funnel.Progress Bluevine’s thinking on marketing measurement, working with operational and engineering teams to onboard new vendors and optimize existing ones, refining data pipelines that allow for clear marketing performance insightsPartner with our business intelligence and data engineering teams to run workflows, define requirements and project roadmap to ensure consistent data availability, data quality and data accessibilityUtilize multiple data sets and business intuition to perform ad hoc data analyses to understand trends and performance across customer segments and productsAlign with agencies and external partners on campaign setup, testing, and tracking.

What We Look For

Bachelor's degree from a top university, ideally in a business or quantitative field7+ years of experience in an analytics or strategy capacity with a focus on marketing5+ years of experience at technology companies (Financial Services a plus)A proven expert in understanding how paid media can generate demand for a high-growth businessDeep understanding of Digital Marketing channels (SEO, SEM, Display, Retargeting, Video, Paid Social, and Radio) & Growth Analytics (Segmentation, Attribution and Data Modeling)In-depth experience with marketing analytics and testing platforms (Google Analytics, CDPs, Optimizely, etc.) and CRM tools (Salesforce Data Cloud and Marketing Cloud).Expertise in various marketing attribution tools and methodologies (Multi-touch, Media Mix Modeling)Comfort designing and executing analysis on large data sets, including experience pulling data using SQLExperience creating data visualizations and dashboards, ideally with business intelligence tools (Tableau, Looker, PowerBI, etc)Interest and experience in data governance and scaling when developing reports used for insightsA bias toward action paired with strong organizational and documentation skillsExcellent problem-solving skills and an ability to gather information, work with data to solve conceptual problems, and drive cross-functional executionStrong verbal and written communication skills across formats (email, slides, dashboards)Comfort working on multiple high-priority projects concurrently, including with limited time and ambiguous dataPassion for BlueVine and our mission, including marketing to small and medium-sized businesses

New Hire Base Salary Range: $105,700.00 to $129,500.00

This role is also eligible to earn annual performance-based incentive compensation in the form of a cash bonus.

Every product we make and every task we undertake is inspired by the famous words of our founder Gert Boyle: “It’s perfect. Now make it better.” As pioneers of relentless improvement, we are constantly evolving.

YOU ARE

A Dynamic, proactive Supply Chain Planning ManagerA Natural Team PlayerPerformance Focused and able to bring a structured, agile approach to performance managementA strong communicator able to take complex topics and simplify into short, insightful, actionable, audience ready actionsCommercially savvy/business oriented with a growth mindset and a can-do attitudeFluent in English, Available to work full-time and to travel on a regular basis to our Emerging Brand HQ’s

This role will partner closely with stakeholders in Marketing, Business Development, and Sales Operations to identify ways to strategically drive incremental pipeline through data-driven recommendations, analytics, best practices, and efficient processes aligned to our marketing and organizational goals. Through rigorous data analysis, this role will also focus on maintaining marketing KPIs, reporting, and driving insights for the Marketing team.

 Provides proactive, accurate, and prescriptive intelligence to the Marketing and Sales departments.  Supports and builds the roadmap for the marketing technology stack to support pipeline growth and marketing objectives.  Creates, maintains, and analyzes standard reports and dashboards to provide visibility to Marketing and Senior Leadership.  Maintains all marketing data and drive usage of current and future marketing technology.  Partners across Operations teams on marketing integrations with CRM (Salesforce) to ensure proper data flow from lead to sales qualified opportunities.  Builds and maintains global reporting and intelligence models to understand, inform, and drive marketing effectiveness throughout cross-functional teams.  Responsible for marketing cadence packages for reporting and overall performance management.  Analyzes each stage of the marketing and sales funnel to optimize lead generation and provide areas for improvement.  Tracks and reports on marketing campaigns and lifecycle stages providing detailed and summary presentations for Leadership team.  Works closely with Vice President of Marketing, Demand Generation, and Sales Leadership to provide status updates and report performance to goals.  Contributes to the marketing planning and budgeting related processes.  Other duties as assigned.

 Bachelor's degree in Business Analytics, Marketing, Finance, Statistics, Economics, Mathematics, or another related field.  3+ years of experience in marketing operations, marketing analytics, or similar roles; preferably in a B2B SaaS environment.  Experience with Salesforce and Marketo (or similar marketing automation tool) required; Experience with Bizible, Demandbase, PowerBI/Tableau preferred.  Strong critical thinking skills, efficient with limited resources and information.  Excellent verbal and written communication skills, comfortable with communicating upwards.  Entrepreneurial approach to solving ambiguous or complex problems.  Proven experience analyzing, organizing, and interpreting data for the design and implementation of strategic plans.  Superior attention to detail.  Skillful in Microsoft Office Suite, particularly Excel and PowerPoint.

At TikTok, we're committed to a process of continuous innovation and improvement in our user experience and safety controls. We're proud to be able to serve a global community of more than a billion people who use TikTok to creatively express themselves and be entertained, and we're dedicated to giving them a platform that builds opportunity and fosters connection. We also take our responsibility to safeguard our community seriously, both in how we address potentially harmful content and how we protect against unauthorized access to user data.

U.S. Data Security (“USDS”) is a standalone department of TikTok in the U.S. This new security-first division was created to bring heightened focus and governance to our data protection policies and content assurance protocols to keep U.S. users safe. Our focus is on providing oversight and protection of the TikTok platform and user data in the U.S., so millions of Americans can continue turning to TikTok to learn something new, earn a living, express themselves creatively, or be entertained. The teams within USDS that deliver on this commitment daily span Trust & Safety, Security & Privacy, Engineering, User & Product Ops, Corporate Functions and more.

Our TikTok Search Operation team plays a key role in improving TikTok users’ search experience by investigating user feedback, evaluating search results, analyzing data, etc.

Responsibilities - What You'll do
1. In-depth understanding and mining of users' needs in the search direction through user research, competitive product analysis and other methods;
2. Optimization iterations such as search intent recognition, word segmentation, recall and sorting to improve search conversion and traffic revenue;
3. Collect, analyze and locate problems, formulate improvement plans and priorities, and follow up and measure improvement effects;
4. Cooperate with product and technical parties to promote the continuous improvement of search quality and user experience. 

Qualifications

 1. Bachelor's degree or above;
2. 2 years+ Search product domain experience required
3. Experience with data analysis, identifying trends and reporting out on findings

Even Better If You Have 
- Familiarity with SEO business, understanding recommended products or experience in product data analysis is preferred
- Experience in data labeling, user feedback, content moderation or similar operation jobs

Description:
Job DescriptionSENIOR ANALYST, STRATEGIC INITIATIVES AND MARKET INSIGHTS, Resource Development, to engage in market research, consumer and donor behavior analysis, financial and trend analysis, surveying, benchmarking, and goal-setting scenario planning related to campaigns, fundraising programs, peer benchmarking, campaign feasibility analysis, economic conditions, and the nonprofit sector and philanthropy as a whole. Will serve as a subject-matter expert and resource for creating bespoke special reports, white papers, and presentations.

PREFERRED: knowledge of prospect development, pipeline management, library science, and/or information management.
Must be willing and able to occasionally travel and work evenings and weekends.
This is a hybrid position with a combination of on-campus and remote work.
